system.description: The character's powers spring from them being a member of the subspecies Homo superior. They have a latent X-Gene that grants them powers, often triggered at adolescence.
system.examples: Cyclops, Jean Grey, Storm, Walvering (Lopan), Wolverine (Laura Kinney).

system.description: The characier is a member of a group of people who are persecuted for simply being themselves.

As a mutant, the character is automatically a citizen of the island-nation of Krakoa and can travel to and from there freely. Also, if they are killed and the Fiveâ€”a group of powerful mutants-are able to work together, the character can be resurrected into an identical new body with most of their memories intact. If killed in Otherworld, the character can still be resurrected, but they will be changed in unpredictable ways. Just how this might affect the character is up to the Narrator.
The character has mutant genes that cause them to develop super-powers
